description: This elaborate crown symbolizes the spiritual essence of a Yoruba ruler and once belonged to the king of Idowa in Nigeria. The faces outlined with beads establish a link to past kings, who serve as influential ancestors to the present one, while multiple birds allude to the supernatural powers of women. The beaded veil protected onlookers from the king’s gaze.
artist_info:
Yoruba
Idowa
Nigeria
Coastal West Africa
title: Crown (Ade)
